intro: Lophopappus cuneatus, commonly known as the slender goatweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and foliage with a rough, hairy texture. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a creeping growth habit with branching stems. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Lophopappus cuneatus is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to arid environments.
